intro: Glossorhyncha carnea, commonly known as the red-stemmed globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which are often reddish in color. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils. Glossorhyncha carnea is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus.
